messages.content: What is Plato's most famous contribution to philosophy?
Plato's most famous contribution is the theory of forms (or ideas), which aims to solve what is now known as the problem of universals.
Who were some of the pre-Socratic thinkers that influenced Plato?
Plato was influenced by the pre-Socratic thinkers Pythagoras, Heraclitus, and Parmenides.
What is the name of the school of philosophy founded by Plato?
The school of philosophy founded by Plato is called the Academy.
